page.title: 10CYCLING SAFETY IN HAILSHAM
page.content:
The main reason for cycling proficiency in school is to teach 11 year old children how to be safe on the road. There are 2 tests after 5 weekly lessons, a written test and a test where a road safety officer watches the children riding their bicycles. The training is done on the playground. The ladies who help are all volunteers. Cyclists learn to ride with the ball of their foot on the pedal. They have to do the following:- left hand turn, right hand turn, an emergency stop and cycling around obstacles. They have to learn always to be careful on the road. About a week after they start training a policeman comes to check that their bicycles are roadworthy.
.
